p: Communication was cited as being a key component to shifts in gender norms, sexual behaviour change and adoption of HIV prevention strategies. A CAT member (Community Action Team 2, 6 month interview) stated that ‘when it comes to gender there is communication in the house and no one who uses power’, while one of the male community members (Community member 6, male, no age data,) explained that ‘it doesn’t mean that when you are the man in a house you have to take the final decision, … but to sit down and talk; you can build a good thing.’
